info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 7:48AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Areas of fog continue to develop across coastal sections of Deep South Texas this morning... Surface observations and satellite images indicate that areas of fog continue to develop across the coastal sections of deep south Texas. Visibilities will be reduced to 1 to 3 miles in general with these areas of fog. Some patchy dense fog may reduce visibilities to a quarter of a mile in some locations. These areas of fog will lift and burn off later this morning with daytime heating and visibilities will improve as a result. Early morning motorists are urged to reduce speed, use low beam headlights, and avoid following other vehicles too closely in areas of dense fog through the morning hours.
